info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 3:12PM CDT until April 8 at 3:08AM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Spring River At Imboden affecting Lawrence and Randolph Counties.
Spring River At Hardy affecting Fulton and Sharp Counties.
For the Spring River...including Hardy, Imboden...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Spring River at Hardy.
* WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flood in March 2008 crested at 22.29 feet. Water over U.S. Highway 63 on the east side of town. Lower lying businesses in Old Town and City Hall flooded. Water over Spring Street at bridge. Water over railroad.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest near 23 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 72 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 315 PM CDT.
